title: Thanksgiving Turkey Art Display
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Friday 

November 

21, 

2025

Friday November 21, 2025

summary: A large collaborative turkey artwork is displayed in the school, featuring a brown turkey body with googly eyes and yellow beak/feet, surrounded by colorful feathers that spread across the wall. Each feather appears to be individually decorated by students with various patterns, colors, and designs, creating a festive Thanksgiving display.

title: Thanksgiving Break and Return Date
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: Have a Happy Thanksgiving! We are so thankful for all of our Kramer kiddos and families! Enjoy the week off!Students return Monday December 1st.

summary:
Kramer Elementary wishes families a Happy Thanksgiving and thanks students and families for their participation. **Students return to school on Monday, December 1st** after the Thanksgiving break.

**This week's Kramer PAX Leaders** recognized for good behavior:
- **KG:** Otis Cherry, An'an Dong, Shep Kleibscheidel, Sophia Smith
- **1st:** Bryce Richardson, Vivienne Smiley, Dylan Wyatt
- **2nd:** Finley Peterson, Theo Siambekos
- **3rd:** Benjen Bufler, Ava Oppliger, Caleb Wiseman, Alicia Zheng
- **4th:** Nevaeh Hubbard, Gavin McCall, Aaliyah Pernell, Bentley Ramey
- **5th:** Gavin boling, Eden Chen, Elliot Ream, Sophia Webb

event_info.title: Students Return from Thanksgiving Break
event_info.description:
Kramer Elementary wishes families a Happy Thanksgiving and thanks students and families for their participation. **Students return to school on Monday, December 1st** after the Thanksgiving break.

title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources Available
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALAWANDA 

FOOD 

RESOURCES

TALAWANDA FOOD RESOURCES

KRAMER FREE PANTRY
The food pantry in front of Kramer is stocked! Please take any items you may need for your family. Talawanda has many resources available to help in a time of need. Please contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 for any needs you or your family may have.If you would like to donate to the pantry, contact Chelsea or drop off donations to the Kramer office.

OTHER TALAWANDA FREE RESOURCES
SEE IMAGES BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

summary: The **Kramer Free Pantry** is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. To access pantry services, donate items, or learn about other Talawanda family resources, contact **Chelsea Pike, Kramer Social Worker, at 513-273-3511** or pikec@talawanda.org. Donations can also be dropped off at the Kramer office.

title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled & Community Programs
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

Please note that the November 18th PTG meeting is being RESCHEDULED to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This move allows interested members to attend the November 18th seminar titled "Building a Tech Healthy Household" in the THS auditorium from 6 to 7:30 pm. Thank you for your patience!

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary:
The **November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm** (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th. 

Additional programs:
- **Oxford Lions Club eyeglasses collection**: Donate used eyeglasses and cases to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by early December
- **Read At Home (RAH)**: K-2nd grade program begins Wednesday, September 24thâ€”students record books read at home for rewards
- **Kroger Rewards**: Link your Kroger card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to generate donations with purchases

PEOPLE UNITED FOR SELF HELP
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

*WHAT'S 

COMING 

UP*

*WHAT'S COMING UP*

summary:
**Community Resources:** PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. Additional community events include Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro Oxford for grades 3-6, Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), English Language CafÃ© at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and bus driver positions available through Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting rate, $16/hr field trip rate, call 513-273-3150).

**Upcoming School Events:** Key dates include PTG meetings, grade-level music concerts, K-Kids meetings, winter break (12/22-1/6), spring break (3/30-4/6), Mother/Son Dance (1/31), Field Day (5/8), and last day of school (5/21).

title: PAX Classroom Leaders Highlighted This Week
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: Great things happening at Kramer again! This week we start highlighting our PAX classroom leaders. Every week we will feature new leaders. See the PAX section below to see what we are working on the next two months.One more week till Thanksgiving break! Have a great weekend!

summary:
Kramer Elementary is beginning to highlight PAX classroom leaders weekly. This week's **Kramer PAX Leaders** include:
- **KG:** Amelia Chen, Lorelai Dougherty, Hannah Neim, Josue Perez Gomes
- **1st:** Caroline Butler, Cora King, Hunter Stewart, Oscar Villanueva-Fuentes
- **2nd:** Charles Hricko, Lucy Ransdell, Avery Reece, Aiden Todd
- **3rd:** Kendall Gloyeske, Lucian Miller, Keyla Perez Gomez, Audrey Ream
- **4th:** Abby Bulanda, Luke Hricko, Liam Morrow, Levi Smith
- **5th:** Sonia Clark, Alyssa Martinez

One week remains until Thanksgiving break (November 24-28).

source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
HOLIDAY 

ADOPT 

- 

A 

- 

FAMILY

HOLIDAY ADOPT - A - FAMILY
Kramer Holiday Amazon Wishlist: https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/20IM1FE5Z3VJ2?ref_=wl_share

summary: Support Kramer families this holiday season through the **Adopt-A-Family program**. Purchase items from the [Amazon Wishlist](https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/20IM1FE5Z3VJ2?ref_=wl_share) and gifts will go directly to Kramer students or families needing extra support. For questions or if your family needs holiday assistance, contact **Chelsea Pike at pikec@talawanda.org**.

summary: This page highlights community resources and upcoming Kramer Elementary events. **PUSH** provides home repair grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District (513-523-8100, [push-oxford.org](http://www.push-oxford.org/)). Additional opportunities include a **shoe donation drive** for 4Paws for Ability (collection until December 1st, any style/size accepted), **Cincinnati Youth Choir Vivo Coro Oxford** for grades 3-6 (Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), **English Language CafÃ©** at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and **bus driver positions** with Petermann Transportation (starting pay $20/hr, call 513-273-3150). The calendar includes numerous school events through May including K-Kids meetings, concerts, conferences, Field Day, and breaks for Thanksgiving, Winter, and Spring.

title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALAWANDA 

FOOD 

RESOURCES

TALAWANDA FOOD RESOURCES

KRAMER FREE PANTRY
The food pantry in front of Kramer is stocked! Please take any items you may need for your family. Talawanda has many resources available to help in a time of need. Please contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 for any needs you or your family may have.If you would like to donate to the pantry, contact Chelsea or drop off donations to the Kramer office.

OTHER TALAWANDA FREE RESOURCES
SEE IMAGES BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

summary: The **Kramer Free Pantry** is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take any items they need for their families. For questions, donations, or to access additional Talawanda family resources, contact **Chelsea Pike** (Kramer Social Worker) at **513-273-3511** or **pikec@talawanda.org**, or drop donations at the Kramer office.

title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

Please note that the November 18th PTG meeting is being RESCHEDULED to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This move allows interested members to attend the November 18th seminar titled "Building a Tech Healthy Household" in the THS auditorium from 6 to 7:30 pm. Thank you for your patience!

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

KRAMER LOST & FOUND

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The **November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM** (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th at THS auditorium (6-7:30 PM). Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases for children in need (donate by early December to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary or Shaunna Tafelski at Board Office), Kramer's Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders with first reward day September 24th, and a reminder to link your **Kroger Rewards card** to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

title: November 2025 Lunch Menu Available
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
*NOVEMBER 

LUNCH 

MENU*

*NOVEMBER LUNCH MENU*

summary:
The **Kramer Elementary November 2025 lunch menu** features daily meal options with a choice of milk included. Notable items include:
- **Monday, November 3**: Fish Sandwich or Popcorn Shrimp, Fish Nuggets, Homestyle Baked Beans, Celery Sticks with Ranch, Mixed Fruit
- **Tuesday, November 4**: No School
- **Wednesday, November 5**: Beef Pretzel Dog, Seasoned Green Beans, Fresh Cucumber Slices with Ranch, Fresh Grapes
- **Thursday, November 6**: National Nacho Day - Tortilla Chips, Warm Cheese Cup & Salsa, Taco Fiesta Black Beans, Salsa or Marinara Cup, Pineapple Tidbits
- **Friday, November 7**: 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza, Honey Glazed Carrots, Fresh Romaine Garden Salad, Frozen Fruit Sidekick
- **Monday, November 18**: Holiday Meal - Roast Turkey and Gravy, Garlic Knot Roll, Mashed Potatoes, Seasoned Green Beans, Pumpkin Applesauce
- **November 24-28**: Thanksgiving Break - No School

Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

summary:
The **Community Page** features local resources and upcoming school events. **PUSH** (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs - call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. View the full community events page at the link above. 

**Key upcoming dates include:**
- **No School:** Nov 4 (Professional Development), Nov 24-28 (Thanksgiving Break), Dec 22-Jan 6 (Winter Break)
- **Music Concerts:** Nov 12 (4th Grade), Dec 3 (5th Grade), Feb 25 (3rd Grade), Mar 10 (2nd Grade)
- **Special Events:** Mother/Son Dance (Jan 31), Field Day (May 8), Last Day of School (May 21)

Full calendar details are listed in the original post.

title: Halloween Celebration and Lost & Found Reminder
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
Happy Halloween!What an interesting week at Kramer Elementary! You could tell the kids were ready to celebrate today. Thank you to all of our parents and volunteers who came in to help with class parties and view our parade!Please see the PTG section below regarding our lost and found. We have accumulated quite the pile! Check the pictures below or come in to the office to see if anything belongs to your student. Anything left after Thanksgiving break will be donated.** NO SCHOOL TUESDAY 11/4 FOR ELECTION DAY**We hope everyone has a great weekend!

summary:
Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween this week with class parties and a parade. Thank you to all parents and volunteers who helped! **Important reminders:**
- Check the **lost and found** - there's a large pile of items. View photos in the newsletter or visit the office. Unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break.
- **No school Tuesday, November 4th** for Election Day.

title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer Playground
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Unplug 

and 

Play 

Event 

- 

11/5/2025

Unplug and Play Event - 11/5/2025
Mark your calendar for this fun event planned by our Unplug and Play group!

*PTG*

*PTG*

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

KRAMER LOST & FOUND

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: **Unplug & Play Kramer** is a flashlight fun event at dusk on **Wednesday, November 5, 2025** from **5:30-7:00 PM** at the **Kramer playground**. Kids receive a flashlight and engage in independent creative play while parents relax and chat with other parents and staff. Bring a lawn chair! Additional items include: a PTG meeting on **Tuesday, December 2nd at 7PM** (virtual), a **LaRosa's Pizza fundraiser on Thursday, November 13 from 4PM-close** (mention Kramer on receipt), and **Reading At Home (RAH) program** for K-2nd graders starting September 24th. Connect your **Kroger Rewards card** to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to support the school.

Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

summary:
**Conference Meal Thanks:** PTG thanks volunteers and donors, especially El Potrero, for supporting teacher and staff conference meals.

**Read At Home (RAH) Program:** Kindergarten through 2nd grade families can participate in the voluntary reading program starting Wednesday, September 24th (first reward day). Students record books read at home and turn in sheets weekly for alternating rewards: student-selected books or small prizes.

**Kroger Community Rewards:** Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG once, and Kroger will donate a percentage of your purchases to the PTG. Sign up at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The **Community Page** features local resources and upcoming events. **PUSH** (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical home repairs - call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. View more community events at the Talawanda Community Page link. The page also includes an extensive school calendar with events from October through May, including cereal drives, field trips, concerts, PTG meetings, and school breaks.

title: Health Guidelines from Nurse Briede
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
*NURSE 

NOTES*

*NURSE NOTES*

summary:
**Contact Information:** Nurse Virginia Briede - briedev@talawanda.org, 513-273-3554

**When to Keep Students Home:**
- **Fever of 100Â°F or more:** Student must stay home until fever-free for 24 hours minimum without medication (Tylenol or Motrin)
- **Vomiting/diarrhea:** Student must be free of symptoms for 24 hours before returning to school

**Head Lice Alert:** A few cases have been detected in the building. Check your child's hair regularly, especially after sleepovers. Avoid sharing brushes. If treatment is needed, wash all bedding and dry on high heat. Contact the clinic for assistance purchasing lice treatment. [Link provided for article: "Staying Ahead of Head Lice"]
